definition: (classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: No wonder now zombies are synonymous with being Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 无怪乎“行尸走肉”成了中国人的定义同义语。

sentences.english: Little wonder the prime minister looks anxious.
sentences.chinese: 这也就无怪乎总理大人看上去愁眉不展了。

sentences.english: With such a pack of wolves running wild, no wonder the country's affairs are in chaos.
sentences.chinese: 国家有此一群虎狼，无怪乎国事不可收拾。

sentences.english: No wonder so many people all his life to live not enron, live very tired.
sentences.chinese: 无怪乎有太多的人一生都活得不安然，活得好累。

definition: none doesn't/there is none who isn't/everyone
it goes to show that/one can see
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
were it not for/if not for
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
there is a reason for it/(of sth) not incidental
